items.title: Mark Zuckerberg says Apple hasn’t innovated since the iPhone. He’s forgetting about this one major thing
items.summary:
- Mark Zuckerberg criticized Apple for not innovating since the iPhone's launch, suggesting they've been stagnant for two decades.
- He expressed concerns over App Store fees, emphasizing his belief that Apple is losing its edge in innovation.
- The article argues that Apple has innovated in areas like digital privacy, which have directly affected Meta's business, challenging Zuck's views on innovation being solely hardware-focused.

items.title: ‘The TikTok era comes to an end’: Creators are revealing their secrets, saying goodbye ahead of the U.S. ban
items.summary:
- TikTok influencers are sharing secrets and saying goodbye as the platform faces a potential ban in the U.S.
- The Supreme Court upheld a law requiring TikTok to divest from its Chinese parent company or face penalties starting January 19.
- Users are encouraging followers to connect on other platforms before the likely shutdown, with many migrating to the Chinese app Xiaohongshu (RedNote).
- Creators like Charlie Puth and Victoria Paris have posted farewell messages and recaps of their favorite content.

items.title: The Supreme Court’s decision on TikTok may have just turned a generation off politics
items.summary:
- The Supreme Court upheld a law mandating TikTok's parent company, ByteDance, to sell the app or face a ban in two days.
- This decision affects TikTok's 170 million users, predominantly younger and politically engaged individuals.
- The ruling may have long-term ramifications for political engagement among young users, who feel alienated by elected officials.
- The ban is seen as a significant loss for a platform that serves as a vital community and expression outlet for many.
- Younger Americans are more likely to oppose the ban, highlighting a disconnect with current political powers.

items.title: Supreme Court upholds TikTok ban. No one knows what comes next
items.summary:
- The Supreme Court upheld a law requiring TikTok to shut down unless its parent company, ByteDance, sells the app.
- The court agreed with the U.S. government about national security risks posed by TikTok’s data collection practices.
- The ruling is seen as a setback for free speech advocates, raising concerns about government suppression of speech.

items.title: Elon Musk’s Starship rocket explodes during SpaceX flight test
items.summary:
- SpaceX's Starship rocket broke up minutes after launch from Texas on Thursday.
- The launch occurred at 5:38 p.m. EST (2238 GMT), and contact was lost eight minutes after liftoff.
- The incident caused airlines to divert flights over the Gulf of Mexico to avoid falling debris, leading to delays in Miami and Fort Lauderdale airports.
- The FAA temporarily slowed plane operations in the affected area but has since resumed normal operations.

items.title: TikTok ban will not be enforced by Biden
items.author: Zeke Miller, Josh Boak, Michelle L. Price, Mary Clare Jalonick
items.summary:
- President Biden decided not to enforce the TikTok ban set to take effect January 19, leaving the decision to President-elect Trump.
- Congress mandated ByteDance divest TikTok by January 19 under a law signed by Biden.
- TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew is expected to attend Trump’s inauguration.
- Incoming national security adviser indicated they may extend the deadline to find an American buyer.
- Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer advocated for more time to ensure a buyer before banning TikTok.
- Senator Tom Cotton blocked a bill to extend the deadline, labeling TikTok as a 'Chinese Communist spy app.'
- The Supreme Court heard a legal challenge to the divestment law, likely upholding it.

items.title: ‘There’s no stone left unturned’: Alejandro Mayorkas on bringing AI into the DHS
items.summary:
- Alejandro Mayorkas, as Secretary of DHS, faced numerous challenges including impeachment efforts, fentanyl crisis, and terrorism.
- His tenure coincided with the rise of generative AI, aiming to improve efficiency and responsiveness within the DHS.
- Successfully developed an AI roadmap, established the AI Safety and Security Board, and created an AI Corps.
- Notable achievement includes training AI to simulate refugee experiences for officer training, enhancing responses based on trauma.

items.title: Makers of autonomous vehicles want to change the world—but first they want to change regulations
items.summary:
- Aurora Innovation plans to launch its autonomous trucking services in April but faces regulatory challenges regarding safety triangle requirements.
- The company has filed a court case to allow the use of flashing lights instead of safety triangles on uncrewed vehicles.
- This proposed change is supported by organizations such as the Fraternal Order of Police and American Trucking Associations.
- Experts caution that as self-driving vehicles become more prevalent, the existing road rules may need to adapt for machine readability, impacting human drivers.

items.title: 3 big predictions for AI in financial services in 2025
items.summary:
- By 2025, AI will enhance personalized experiences in financial services rather than replacing human roles.
- Collaborative AI will streamline processes, leading to faster and simpler customer interactions.
- Financial service providers will focus on niche solutions tailored for specific customer segments, moving away from one-size-fits-all approaches.
- Success will hinge on leveraging AI to bundle services that address unique customer needs, creating seamless experiences.

items.title: With full speed ahead on AI investment, does ROI matter?
items.author: Sowmyanarayan Sampath
items.summary:
- The projected spending on AI is expected to reach $1 trillion in the coming years.
- Companies need to balance between investment and the economic value generated, especially in chip production. 
- Businesses are categorized into three types: Big Tech, supply chain companies, and applied AI businesses, each having different ROI considerations.
- Big Tech can afford to invest heavily without immediate ROI pressure due to their overall solid financial performance.
- Supply chain companies must overinvest in capacity to meet demand despite the risks of overestimating.
- Applied AI companies focus on measured investments with ROI targets, emphasizing strategic spending based on proven progress.
- Historical context is provided, comparing current AI investment trends to the dot-com boom, suggesting potential for both significant risk and reward.

items.title: Americans keep falsely claiming this random man from Vancouver is RedNote’s CEO
items.summary:
- Jerry from Vancouver is mistakenly believed to be the CEO of the Chinese app RedNote after posting a welcome video.
- His video went viral on TikTok, leading to confusion among users who assumed he held the CEO position.
- Jerry clarified in a TikTok video that he is just a regular user and not affiliated with RedNote’s leadership.

items.title: TikTok refugees or propagandists? China’s RedNote users share mixed responses to U.S. influx
items.summary:
- Users of the Chinese app RedNote welcomed U.S. users, described as "TikTok refugees," with selfies and messages.
- The app has become a channel for cultural exchange amidst a looming TikTok ban in the U.S. on national security grounds.
- Over 700,000 new users joined RedNote as Americans seek alternatives to TikTok, which has 170 million users in the U.S.
- There are mixed feelings among existing users, with some expressing concern about American influences on the platform.

items.title: ‘Welcome, TikTok refugee’: Duolingo sees a 216% spike in U.S. users learning Mandarin
items.summary:
- Duolingo reported a 216% increase in U.S. users learning Mandarin amidst TikTok's impending ban set for January 19.
- Over 700 million users globally are migrating to the Chinese app RedNote, known as Xiaohongshu in China.
- New users often mention TikTok as their source of discovery for Duolingo, indicating a shift in language learning due to the app changes.

items.title: How to test out the new Nintendo Switch 2
items.summary:
- Nintendo revealed the new Nintendo Switch 2, with a launch expected later this year.
- An event to test the Switch 2 will be held in New York (April 4-6), Los Angeles (April 11-13), and Dallas (April 25-27).
- Users can register for a lottery for a chance to attend, with registration open from January 17 to January 26.

items.title: One reason the U.S. government is so spooked by TikTok: AI
items.author: Mark Sullivan
items.summary:
- TikTok could face a shutdown in the U.S. as soon as January 19 unless the Supreme Court intervenes.  
- U.S. government fears ByteDance may share user data with China, which could affect 170 million American users.  
- Concerns are raised that Chinese AI could weaponize TikTok user data to influence U.S. public opinion in the future.  
- Congressional debates intensified as TikTok users protest against the ban, demonstrating the platform's political influence.  
- ByteDance's ownership structure includes 60% international investors, with Chinese government influence through a 'golden share'.  
- Lawmakers are conflicted about total divestiture by ByteDance for security reasons.

items.title: Why school cellphone bans are gaining steam in these red and blue states
items.author: Andrew DeMillo
items.summary:
- Arkansas and California governors support cellphone bans in schools, showing bipartisan agreement.
- At least eight states including California, Florida, and Indiana have enacted bans or restrictions.
- The movement is driven by concerns over mental health and classroom distractions due to cellphone use.
- Critics argue that bans hinder emergency communication for parents and students.

items.title: President Biden’s new executive order aims to bolster national security
items.summary:
- President Joe Biden issued an executive order on Thursday to strengthen the nation's cybersecurity.
- The order demands minimum cybersecurity standards for government technology contractors.
- It aims to facilitate sanctions against foreign governments involved in cyberattacks, particularly targeting entities like hospitals.
- Federal agencies are required to enhance cybersecurity against potential threats from quantum computers.
- The action precedes Biden's departure from office, with hopes it will garner bipartisan support.

items.title: Google inks a Gemini AI chatbot deal with the Associated Press
items.summary:
- Google announced a deal with the Associated Press (AP) to provide real-time news updates through its Gemini AI chatbot.
- AP will deliver a feed of information to enhance user results in the Gemini app, marking Google's first deal with a news publisher.
- Financial terms of the agreement were not disclosed, and it remains unclear how Google will present AP's content or credit the organization.
- AP has a history of seeking to diversify revenue streams, including a recent deal with OpenAI.
- Concerns have been raised about AI companies using news media content without permission, impacting revenue for traditional news outlets.
- The AP faces significant revenue loss from newspaper customers while trying to adapt to the evolving media landscape.

items.title: How Letterboxd went mainstream
items.summary:
- Letterboxd’s highest-rated film in 2020 was *Minari*, earning $15.5 million globally.
- In 2024, *Dune: Part Two* topped the charts with $714.4 million.
- Letterboxd grew from 1.8 million members in mid-2020 to over 17 million, with six million joining in the last year.
- The platform has transitioned from a niche community to mainstream popularity, expanding beyond film nerds.

items.title: Substack is trying to court displaced TikTok creators
items.summary:
- Substack CEO Chris Best invites TikTok creators to transition to their platform amid potential TikTok ban in the U.S.
- A $25,000 prize will be awarded to the creator who makes a TikTok video that inspires others to join Substack.
- The winner is set to be announced on January 19, 2024, and will also have the chance to work with Substack as a creative adviser.
- TikTok creators can utilize various content formats on Substack, including long-form video posts and live video features.
- Many TikTok influencers are already promoting their Substack newsletters to their audiences.
